main event: Three brothers, ages 14, 16, and 19, sighted an unidentified round, gray object with two lights on one side, moving northward over downtown Detroit, Michigan on July 18, 1958.
interesting points: The object was visible for approximately 15-25 minutes.
The object was observed at a high altitude, about the size of a dime at arm's length.
The object moved from downtown Detroit in a south-west direction before disappearing behind clouds.
The witnesses were interviewed and provided detailed descriptions of the object's appearance and flight path.
The report concludes that the object was likely a balloon, but the witnesses disagreed and believed it was not a known object.
sighted object: Round, gray object with two lights on one side
